title.narrative: CHILD PROTECTION IN EMERGENCIES

description.narrative: To support schools to maintain water and sanitation standards in emergency affected countries., which contributes to Child Protection And Emergencies, Promotion Of Care, Mental Health And Psychosocial Well-Being And Justice, Protection From Violence, Exploitation, Abuse And Neglect, Protection From Violence, Exploitation, Abuse And Neglect (Covid). UNICEF aims to achieve this through Systems Strengthening And Institution Building, Systems Strengthening To Leave No One Behind. This contributes to the following Country Programme result: By 2021, national legislation is implemented to prevent, mitigate and address violence and other childhood abuses and the justice, education, public health, security and other sectors observe children's rights to this protection.

sector.narrative: Community-based child, adolescent, parent and caregiver mental health and psychosocial support through child protection

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: To support schools to maintain water and sanitation standards in emergency affected countries.

description.narrative: UNICEF supported 5 countries, directly impacted by natural disasters over the past five years, at increasing and institutionalizing their capacity to help children and their families to be better prepared and to cope with traumatic events. UNICEF contributed to the development of a Regional Protocol for the Integration of Protection for Children and Adolescents in emergency and disaster situations to enhance response across Caribbean countries. Return to Happiness, a regionally adopted psycho-social support (PSS) programme, has been enhanced to reach children under 5 and adolescents and integrated into the education sector to expand PSS services for children. | Status:On-track | As-of Date:04/01/2020
